official-title.#text:
To authorize the use of United States Armed Forces against the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant
			 (ISIL).

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following joint resolution; which was referred to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Authorization for the Use of Military Force Against the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Authorization for the Use of Military Force Against the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

text.#text: This joint resolution may be cited as the

header.#text: Authorization for limited use of United States Armed Forces

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: is authorized to use the Armed Forces of the United States as the

determines to be necessary and appropriate in order to defend the national
			 security of the United States against the continuing threat posed by the
			 Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall terminate at the close of the date that is 120 days after the
			 date of the enactment of this joint resolution.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Authorization for the Use of Military Force Against the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)/s:2/ss:a

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 8(a)(1) of the War Powers Resolution

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
declares that this section
			 is intended to constitute specific statutory authorization within the
			 meaning of

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 5(b) of the War Powers Resolution

text.#text: Consistent with

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: War Powers Resolution

determines may be necessary and

Not later than 60 days after the date of the enactment of this joint resolution, the President
			 shall submit to the

text.#text: the
Whereas ISIL jihadists have directly threatened the United States and its allies;

Whereas ISIL poses a direct threat to United States personnel in Iraq and to the immediate security
			 and stability of the Middle East region;

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , consistent with the requirements of the

text.#text:
Whereas, on August 8, 2014, United States Armed Forces conducted airstrikes in Iraq as authorized
			 by
			 the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: War Powers Resolution
public-law/93/148
War Powers Resolution

to obtain congressional authorization for
			 the continued use of United States Armed Forces after the limitations

text.#text: Whereas the
Whereas

has authority under the Constitution to take action in order to deter and

text.#text:
Whereas it is in the national security interest of the United States to restore international peace
			 and security to the Middle East region: Now, therefore, be it
